description.narrative: The objectives of the Natural Resource Management project are to enhance the institutional capacity to manage water and forest resources, reduce the incidence and severity of water shocks in river catchments, and improve the livelihoods of communities participating in the co-management of water and forests. Achievements under the project will be measured by indicators tracking changes in organizations and their performance, in the health of the natural resource base, and in welfare of participating communities. The Natural Resource Management Project has four components: Water Resource Management and Irrigation, Management of Forest Resources, Livelihood Investments in the Upper Tana Catchment, and Management and Monitoring and Evaluation. The first two components support the legal and institutional reforms contained in recent legislation, as well as investments in catchment areas. The third component provides assistance to communities participating in management of the resources. The fourth provides managerial oversight and monitoring and evaluation for the project.

condition.narrative: Establishment and mainanance of a Regional Project Implementing Committee
Guidelines for establishment and operationalization of CFAs developed.
NIB capacity assessment, training plan and operational manual completed.
Set up and maintainance of a national Project Steering Committee
Submission of yearly project reports (covering one fiscal year)not later than 3 months after the end of one FY.

title.narrative: Production forests whose management has been transferred to the private sector

comment.narrative: All public forests are currently managed by KFS, no management responsibility has been transferred to the private sector.

This target will likely not be reached because, outside of direct project control, the process toward transfer of management ofsome forests to the private sector was stopped by the National Alliance of Community Forest Associations (NACOFA) through a courtinjunction.Note: June 22 value is incorrect and should read 0.

title.narrative: Area of forests in project intervention areas managed according to approved forest management plans.

comment.narrative: Management plans are outdated or not available, forest harvesting banned

More awareness on participatory forest management has been conducted, with support for development of participatory forestmanagement plans, one in Nyeri and another in Mt Elgon forest zones. Target is on track.Note: June 2012 value requires correctionupward to 220,000 ha.

title.narrative: Increased revenue from water use charges collected (in Kenya Shillings)

comment.narrative: Note: This indicator ideally should have read: "Incremental increase in revenue..." and the value should be an increase of 25M(fora total of 267M).

This 18M increase is after only 6 months since last reporting period. Project is on track to achieve end of project target of 36Mdue to improved compliance level since water users such as KENGEN were brought into compliance.Note: June 2012 value requirescorrection to 32M (for a total of 329M).

title.narrative: Community/User groups collaborating with GoK institutions in water and/or forest activities (% of which members are female)

comment.narrative: Percentage of female members = 42%
Percentage of female members = 50%
Percentage of female members = 50.5%Note: end of project target already achieved.Note: June 2012 value requires correction to128 (of which 50% are female)

title.narrative: Implementation of KFS Strategic Plan activities supported

comment.narrative: The KFS Strategic Plan is a five-year document (FY 2010 to 2014), outlining 120 activities under six strategic objectives.

Project providing good support to implementation of activities in KFS strategic plan. For instance, ISO Certification is about 80%complete. Activities include:Establish 500 forest Field SchoolsSupport development and implementation of forest based communityaction plans (CAPs)Stakeholders Forums at national , regional and community levelcreate networks between tree growers, marketsand financial institutionsPromote forest based small and micro enterprises (SME)Survey of indigenous ForestsRehabilitation ofdegraded natural forests Restoration of cleared indigenous forest areas through tree plantingSurvey of ForestboundariesGazettment of new forest areasPreparation of participatory forest management plansSurvey and mapping ofplantationsConduct management inventory of forest plantationsAwareness creation on the Forest Act 2005 in theconservanciesRecruit staff required to support KFS functionsReview Training Needs for the KFS StaffSupport of Trainingprogrammes at KFCTeam Building sessions ca

title.narrative: Area under irrigation in project intervention areas

comment.narrative: This indicator measures area under newly constructed irrigation systems as well as rehabilitation of existing irrigation systems,in particular Mwea with 9,150 Ha, and Bunyala with 270 Ha.

Total target will not be reached because Lower Nzoia construction will now be financed under the the Water Security and ClimateResilience Project; meanwhile the sub-indicator for improved irrigated area will be reached through the successful Mwearehabilitationworks that are advancing according to schedule.

Total target will not be reached because Lower Nzoia construction will now be financed under the the Water Security and ClimateResilience Project; meanwhile the sub-indicator for improved irrigated area will be reached through the successful Mwearehabilitationworks that are advancing according to schedule.
This indicator refers to rehabilitation of existing schemes, in particular Mwea.
This target will not be reached as Lower Nzoia construction will now be financed under the new IDA-financed Water Security andClimate Risk Project.
Target is on-track. Mwea rehabilitation works advancing according to schedule.
This indicator refers to the construction of new irrigation systems in particular Lower Nzoia Scheme.
This target will not be reached as Lower Nzoia construction will now be financed under the new IDA-financed Water Security andClimate Risk Project.
This target will not be reached as Lower Nzoia construction will now be financed under the new IDA-financed Water Security andClimate Risk Project.
Delays in disbursing funds to communities may delay the implementation of planned activities.Note: June 22 ISR value shouldread197 as the text under it implies.

title.narrative: Microcatchment action plans developed by WRUAs and approved by WRMA

comment.narrative: Note: June 2012 value requires correction upward to 36.End of project target achieved. 51 WRUAs developed their SCMPs andapproved by WRMA. Target exceeded due to good community participation.

title.narrative: Area brought under forest cover in project intervention areas

comment.narrative: Target exceeded and will be further exceeded as KFS is expecting to plant an additional 1600 Ha during the long rains in April andMay 2013.

title.narrative: Technical staff from KFS trained in participatory forest management

comment.narrative: Target on track to be met. An additional 150 staff are expected to be trained by April 2013. Priority is given to training forofficers in VMG area who are focusing on community participation, outreach, and development issues facing vulnerable andmarginalized people.Note: ISR17 data should have read 108

title.narrative: DROPPED INDICATOR DURING PROJECT RESTRUCTURING: Annual progress reports produced in time (cummulative)
Vulnerable and Marginalized Group Plans prepared and activities initiated according to defined work schedules

comment.narrative: Target achieved and all plans being implemented.

title.narrative: Scheme farmers satisfied with the Board's operation and maintenance services

comment.narrative: Improved O&M has resulted in increased satisfaction from the beneficiaries. Target is on track to be met.

title.narrative: Cost recovery for O&M of the project's irrigation investments

comment.narrative: Target on track.
